(Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Injection] Does the path logging at line 22 sanitize control characters (\\x00-\\x1F) that could corrupt log files or bypass log analysis tools monitoring validator API activity? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Injection] Can extremely long path strings (>100KB) in HTTP requests cause memory exhaustion or buffer overflows when logged via info.path().to_string() at line 22, potentially crashing validator API nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Path Traversal Logging] Does the path field logging perform any validation to prevent logging of paths containing directory traversal sequences (../, ..\) that could leak internal filesystem structure information? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Unicode Exploitation] Can attackers exploit Unicode normalization issues in path logging (line 22) to create visually identical but byte-different log entries that bypass security monitoring? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Injection] Can malicious HTTP requests with custom or malformed method strings inject control characters into logs via info.method().to_string() at line 21, corrupting log integrity? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Method Validation] Does the method field logging validate that HTTP methods conform to RFC 7231 standards, or can arbitrary strings be logged enabling log pollution attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Injection] Can attackers inject malicious payloads into logs via crafted User-Agent headers captured at line 25, potentially exploiting log analysis tools that parse these headers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Resource Exhaustion] Can extremely large User-Agent headers (>1MB) cause memory exhaustion when info.user_agent() is called at line 25, leading to validator API DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Memory Safety] Does the user_agent field's Option<&'a str> lifetime at line 49 ensure memory safety when logging concurrent requests, or can race conditions cause use-after-free bugs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [XSS in Logs] Can malicious JavaScript payloads in User-Agent headers be logged without sanitization, creating XSS vulnerabilities in web-based log viewers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Log Injection] Can attackers inject newlines or ANSI escape codes via Referer headers captured at line 24 to manipulate log output and hide malicious activity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [HttpRequestLog struct] [Memory Safety] Is the referer field's Option<&'a str> at line 48 properly bounded, or can unbounded referer strings cause stack overflow when constructing HttpRequestLog? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Header Parsing] Can malformed FORWARDED header values at lines 27-30 cause panic or undefined behavior when v.to_str() is called, potentially crashing validator API endpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [IP Spoofing] Does the FORWARDED header logging at lines 27-30 validate the header format per RFC 7239, or can attackers inject arbitrary IP addresses to bypass IP-based access controls? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Trust Boundary] Is the FORWARDED header trusted without validation, allowing attackers to spoof their IP address in logs and evade rate limiting or security monitoring? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [UTF-8 Validation] Does to_str().ok() at line 30 properly handle invalid UTF-8 in FORWARDED headers, or can this cause silent failures hiding malicious forwarding chains? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Rate Limiting Bypass] Can attackers bypass the sampling rate limiter at line 33 by precisely timing 500 error requests to occur just after the Duration::from_secs(1) window expires? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-warp-webserver/src/log.rs] [Function: logger()] [Resource Exhaustion] Does the sample! macro at line 33 properly handle concurrent high-frequency 500 errors, or can race conditions cause all errors to be logged instead of sampled? (High)
